meanings.definition: To connect or link together in a chain or series.
meanings.sent1: The children were catenating paper clips to create a long chain.
meanings.sent2: She was catenating the colorful beads to make a beautiful necklace.
meanings.sent3: The ants were catenating leaves to build their tiny home.
meanings.sent4: His stories were catenating different events into a captivating narrative.
meanings.sent5: The artist was catenating brushstrokes to form a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To concatenate or join together in a continuous sequence.
meanings.sent1: The programmer was catenating strings of code to build the software.
meanings.sent2: They were catenating train cars to form a long freight train.
meanings.sent3: The chef was catenating various ingredients to create a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The singer was catenating notes to compose a melodious song.
meanings.sent5: The students were catenating words to form coherent sentences.
